DataElement.preferredName: Disposition Domain Future Research Activity Cancer Biobank Storage Consent Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication as to whether or not a patient consented to having his/her biological specimens kept/banked for use in future research.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disposition Domain Future Research Activity Cancer Biobank Storage Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition._A time that is yet to come._Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._Permission to do something.

Property.preferredName: Future Research Activity Cancer Biobank Storage Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: A time that is yet to come.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. Concepts.definition: A time that is yet to come.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the the patient consent t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the the patient consent to having his/her biological specimens kept/banked for use in future research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent given for the patient's tissue and/or blood samples to be kept (banked) for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to let researchers bank specimens (such as tumor, blood or bone marrow) for future use to learn about, prevent or treat cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to having his/her tissue, blood, and/or CSF samples kept (banked), for use in research, to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer, or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did donor consent to collection of blood sample for banking for future research, and has not withdrawn consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to have samples that may be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient agree to be in the Contact for Future Research part of this study so that researchers can inform patient if there are new studies they think patient be interested in?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient and/or their parents or legal guardians signed informed consent for APEC14B1 Part A - Eligibility Screening?
